poem:
### Academic Echoes

In lecture halls where echoes roam,  
students chase shadows of unknowns—  
chalked equations and ancient oaths.  
Yet in cubicles and newsrooms' glow,  
words find spine and voices grow.  
Real life waits beyond the tomes,  
where lessons learned must make their homes.  
In halls of thought, we build our own.
